description.S1: Investigate Roseway to find potential company secrets that could be sold to the highest bidder through Gladys.
description.S2: Talking to the scientists around the town would probably be a good place to start.

blurb.B1: After landing at Roseway Landing Pad, you'll make your way through a desolate street and enter Roseway proper.
blurb.B2: If you speak with Orson Shaw and offer to help then you will get the objective to get a hold of his weapon plans.
blurb.B3: These can be found in the Storage Facility to the southeast of Roseway.
blurb.B4: Head to Roseway Communications Room and you can meet Anton Crane, who sent the distress call.
blurb.B5: He reveals that his work might not be entirely legal,
blurb.B6: so corporate cannot know of what has happened.
blurb.B7: You can intimidate (25) to get him to tell you what is going on.
blurb.B8: He's tasked with formulating new and improved dental gel,
blurb.B9: and they accidentally discovered an appetite suppresant.
blurb.B10: He claims a group of malcontents attacked them,
blurb.B11: freed the Raptidons and stole his research.
blurb.B12: You will get 3300xp for agreeing to help,
blurb.B13: and obtain Anton's Lab Keycard and Anton's Pass Code.
blurb.B14: He will also mention you should not kill the Raptidon mother,
blurb.B15: and that the old lab has Jameson, his protege.
blurb.B16: Agree to find him and you'll obtain the quest By His Bootstraps.

description.S1: Anton's research sounds like it'd be valuable to Gladys.

blurb.B1: Leave town and go to Roseway Garden.
blurb.B2: You'll be attacked by a group of Raptidons as you approach Auntie-Biotics Lab 0013
blurb.B3: Then make your way southeast towards the Cover Lab.
blurb.B4: Inside you'll need to speak with Cassandra O'Malley.
blurb.B5: You can kill her or make a deal with her,
blurb.B6: but she has Auntie Cleo's Research Data.

dialog.speaker: Anton (Male)
dialog.utterance: If you've come to end my life, let's be on with it. Oh... not actually one of them, are you?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: No. Did you send the distress call?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: If I was here to kill you, you'd already be dead.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: <Attack> Right the first time. I am here to end your life.

dialog.speaker: Anton (Male)
dialog.utterance: Yes, yes. Anton Crane, lead scientist here.

dialog.speaker: Anton (Male)
dialog.utterance: I must apologize if my call diverted you. I, uh, may have panicked. Everything’s under control now, though, truth be told.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Under control? Not from where I'm standing. What are you hiding?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: What caused you to panic in the first place?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Who did you think I was?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Let's cut to the chase here - tell me what happened.

dialog.speaker: Anton (Male)
dialog.utterance: I’m not at liberty to discuss the nature of the work I’m doing here. Suffice it to say that its importance to me, uh, to the colony, is immeasurable.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: But why cancel the distress call?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Work you’re doing? Working by yourself, are you?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: To you or the colony? Which is it?

dialog.speaker: Anton (Male)
dialog.utterance: My research may not quite fall within "legal parameters," so I’m under orders to maintain wireless silence. However, having your head used as target practice can addle one's thinking.

dialog.speaker: Anton (Male)
dialog.utterance: I cut the call immediately once I'd gathered my wits. The home office can't know what's happening here.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Tell me what you’re actually doing here or I will let them know myself.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I'd think they'd want to be notified first if anything happened here.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Well, guess you don’t need my help.

dialog.speaker: Anton (Male)
dialog.utterance: I suppose it can’t hurt. If I don’t get that research back, my life is over, regardless.

dialog.speaker: Anton (Male)
dialog.utterance: We were tasked with formulating a new and improved dental gel.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Wait, this is all about toothpaste?

dialog.speaker: Anton (Male)
dialog.utterance: One cannot exaggerate the benefits of good dental hygiene. May I continue?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Please do.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Only if you'd like me to punch you in the throat. Can we just cut to the chase here?

dialog.speaker: Anton (Male)
dialog.utterance: While doing research on enzymes specific to the raptidon’s digestive system, we developed an additive which we subsequently discovered to be the most effective appetite suppressant. Ever.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: You can couch it however you like, it's still just toothpaste. Uh, diet toothpaste.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: So what do you need from me?

dialog.speaker: Anton (Male)
dialog.utterance: Not just any diet toothpaste - the ultimate diet toothpaste.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: It's not worth your life. I wouldn't care if it was the ultimate rocket fuel.

dialog.speaker: Anton (Male)
dialog.utterance: Oh, I'm certain it could be made into that as well with only a few changes to its molecular composition. But you're missing the point.

dialog.speaker: Anton (Male)
dialog.utterance: Let's focus for a moment, shall we? Even if you disregard the obvious value of Auntie Cleo's Appezap diet toothpaste in and of itself, we're talking about my career here as well.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: "...Appezap"?

dialog.speaker: Anton (Male)
dialog.utterance: Nice, is it not? Came up with that myself. It's a shame our marketing department is almost as befuddled as my coworkers here.

dialog.speaker: Anton (Male)
dialog.utterance: Hours ago, a group of vicious malcontents fell upon us. Shot up our labs and loosed our research subjects, the raptidons.

dialog.speaker: Anton (Male)
dialog.utterance: If those cretins get their hands on my research… well. They'll need not kill me.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Remove the cretins, retrieve the research. Check. You want I should handle your raptidon problem?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: A little over dramatic, wouldn't you say?

dialog.speaker: Anton (Male)
dialog.utterance: Yes - but don't kill the mother if it's avoidable, we've need of her to replenish our stocks. I think there's gas in the lab somewhere that can be used to put them out.

dialog.speaker: Anton (Male)
dialog.utterance: The research is in the safe in my office - you'll have need of my code, and keycard.

dialog.speaker: Anton (Male)
dialog.utterance: The lab's entrance is in the side of a hill, you can't miss it if you just follow the road. You'll pass by the town's original... by the Grand Architect. Jameson... he's in the old lab...

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Who's Jameson?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I'll find him.

dialog.speaker: Anton (Male)
dialog.utterance: My protégé - I sent him to retrieve some metabolic precursors. And I forgot him.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Sounds like it was chaos. You should give yourself a break.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: You left him to die. Should be ashamed of yourself.

dialog.speaker: Anton (Male)
dialog.utterance: You don't understand. He was my responsibility - all of the people stationed here were - ARE, regardless of their thinking on the matter.

dialog.speaker: Anton (Male)
dialog.utterance: If he has died... too many have been lost. Too many black marks against my name. And far too much paperwork.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: And all you care about is how it affects you.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I'll find him.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Don't like you much, but I'll look into this further and decide what to do.

dialog.speaker: Anton (Male)
dialog.utterance: I'll thank you not to mistake my ambition for callousness.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: What should I mistake it for, compassion?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: You must see how one could do exactly that, can't you?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I stand corrected. I'll be off now.

dialog.speaker: Anton (Male)
dialog.utterance: If my colleagues refuse to take their lives seriously, why should I? All they do is complain. They refuse to see the opportunity afforded us here.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Just wanted to hear you admit that you're a heartless bastard. Thanks.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: You can see why people might think you're callous, though, can't you?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: You make a good point. Good day to you, sir.

dialog.speaker: Anton (Male)
dialog.utterance: Believe what you will, but I'm not the manipulative, ego driven person you think me to be. I'm not.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I guess I'll just have to take your word for it.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: You just keep telling yourself that.

dialog.speaker: Anton (Male)
dialog.utterance: I understand I can come off as manipulative and ego driven. It's something I've always been forced to contend with.

dialog.speaker: Anton (Male)
dialog.utterance: It's just that their constant complaining can begin to wear. They refuse to see the opportunity afforded us here. It's infuriating.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: You really are an insufferable jackass.

dialog.speaker: Anton (Male)
dialog.utterance: Don't you think it weighs on me? He was my responsibility! All of them were - ARE, regardless of their thinking on the matter.

dialog.speaker: Anton (Male)
dialog.utterance: That would surely lighten the weight on my conscience, as I am held to account for the wellbeing of every scientist here.

dialog.speaker: Anton (Male)
dialog.utterance: Too many have been lost. Too many black marks against my name, as it were. And far too much paperwork.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I don't believe their lives mean nothing more to you than paperwork.

dialog.speaker: Anton (Male)
dialog.utterance: Of course they do. Please don't mistake my ambition for callousness.

dialog.speaker: Anton (Male)
dialog.utterance: No, realistic.

dialog.speaker: Anton (Male)
dialog.utterance: Very well. We'd formulated the world's most effective appetite suppressant toothpaste.

dialog.speaker: Anton (Male)
dialog.utterance: We're expendable resources, to be neglected and left to our fates were anything untoward to happen.

dialog.speaker: Anton (Male)
dialog.utterance: No! Please, hold a moment. Our security forces have proven themselves to be quite worthless.

dialog.speaker: Anton (Male)
dialog.utterance: You seem someone not averse to risking your life if the pay were right. Might I interest you in an arrangement of sorts?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I'm listening.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Depends on what you need from me.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Forget it, not interested.

dialog.speaker: Anton (Male)
dialog.utterance: Hours ago, a group of vicious malcontents fell upon us. Shot up our labs and loosed our research subjects, the raptidons.

dialog.speaker: Anton (Male)
dialog.utterance: If those cretins get their hands on my research… well. They'll need not kill me.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: "Malcontents"? "Cretins"? You're a pompous ass, I'm not working for you.

dialog.speaker: Anton (Male)
dialog.utterance: Please, I'm begging you, it's just in my safe - look, I'm trusting you with the code...

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Perhaps you didn't hear me - not interested.

dialog.speaker: Anton (Male)
dialog.utterance: You'd leave a man to his fate without even hearing him out?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Yes I would.

dialog.speaker: Anton (Male)
dialog.utterance: More often than not. Seems I'm the only one who sees the opportunity here.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: And what might that be?

dialog.speaker: Anton (Male)
dialog.utterance: A ticket to the good life once my research plays out. Byzantium - recognition, money, proper facilities. No more uninspired dolts like my associates here.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: With all that at stake, I'd think you'd be begging for someone - anyone's help.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I think I'll be going. Have fun working with the uninspired dolts.

dialog.speaker: Anton (Male)
dialog.utterance: And might you be the sort of person who's, ah, not averse to risking your life? If the pay were right?

dialog.speaker: Anton (Male)
dialog.utterance: Those need not be mutually exclusive. My work would benefit everyone, and not just within our colony.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: If you say so. Would you like to tell me what's happening here?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Not sure I agree with you. I think I'll just be on my way, then.

dialog.speaker: Anton (Male)
dialog.utterance: An attack. One that I'd wager was due to the nature of my research here.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: But why cancel the distress call?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: What are you researching?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Your research? Are you working by yourself?

dialog.speaker: Anton (Male)
dialog.utterance: Why, one of our attackers, of course. Obviously, they were drawn here in an attempt to make off with my research.

dialog.speaker: Anton (Male)
dialog.utterance: Yes, yes, of course.

dialog.speaker: Anton (Male)
dialog.utterance: What? I... uhm... I'm Anton Crane, the lead scientist here.

dialog.speaker: Anton (Male)
dialog.utterance: Then let's be on with it, swine!
